title: Around the Districts : Newtownmountkennedy and Rathdrum
body_text:
Around the Districts: Newtownmountkennedy and Rathdrum
NEWTOWNMOUNTKENNEDY
Notes contact
If you have news or an item to be added to the Newtownmountkennedy Notes, please email Ciara Martin Perks at ciaraperks87@gmail.com or call 087 6380155.
Public Defibrillator
The defibrillator is located at Henry and Rose, Main Street, Newtownmountkennedy. In any emergency dial 999/112, don’t assume somebody else has.
Wicklow ITF Taekwon-Do
Taekwon-Do is the Korean art of self defence and is also a combat sport. Newtown Taekwon-Do Club train every Tuesday and Thursday in Newtownmountkennedy Community Centre.
Beginners always welcome - the club offers 3 classes on Tuesdays an Thursday evenings, we are totally inclusive and cater for all ages and abilities
1st Class, Cubs 7pm-7.30pm - this class is for children aged 5 to 7yrs old. 2nd Class 7.30pm-8.30pm this class is for beginners to Red Tip level all ages teens and adults. 3rd Class 8.30pm-9.30pm this class is for advanced level students only. Red and Black Belts
For more information contact Mick Whelan 0879897217 email mwitaekwondo@gmail.com or James Whelan 0871346168 email jameswhelantkd@gmail.com
Bingo
Bingo is played at Newtownmountkennedy Community Centre every Friday. Doors open at 7.30 p.m., starts at 8.30 p.m. – bring a friend.
GAA club news
The lotto jackpot was not won last week, the numbers were 3,16,19,24. There was 7 match 3 winners. Next week’s jackpot is €18,000. The lotto draw is held every Monday evening at 8pm, tickets are only €2. The next lotto draw will be Monday 12th February. Tickets are available to buy in local outlets including Newtown Credit Union, Nolan’s Post Office, Druids well, Eugene’s, Roma’s, Pat Toolans, Ultima oil, Ann Duffy’s, The Mountkennedy Inn. If you are interested in selling club lotto tickets, please get in contact with James Kelly or Robert Nolan.
Newtown GAA is excited to announce the launch of Gaelic for Dad&Lads. If you are of a certain vintage (no upper age limit), not currently playing competitive football and would like to give it a try please come along to our next session on Wednesday 14th February at 7.30pm at Newtown GAA club. All welcome, NO experience necessary and NO minimum level of fitness required. Look forward to seeing you all. For more information please contact Michael Synnott Tel: 0869061826
Ireland Lights Up walks continue every Wednesday evening from the club house at 7pmif any new residents would like to join us for a walk around the Village and meet new people. Refreshments in the club house afterwards.
Well done to everyone who took part in the MyLife Every Step Counts challenge which concluded last Monday. Everyone did fantastic and we hope it helped to keep you active over the past 6 weeks. Big shout out to Ian McGrath, Sandra Whelan and Lucy Heffernan who topped our leaderboard.
Newtown GAA are taking part in the GAA Green Clubs Programme and would like to hear from anyone in the community who is interested in joining our Green Team. Please contact Margaret Synnott Tel: 086 8936211
Newtown GAA recognise the importance of Healthy Eating and Nutrition for our young people and in particular our teenagers. We have signposted a Midterm Online Healthy Eating Made Easy Online Cookery Course for Teenagers in conjunction with Wicklow Partnership, which will be followed by a Sports Nutrition talk in our clubhouse in the coming weeks.
National Club Draw tickets can be bought on sale from any committee member. Tickets cost €10 and all money goes to club, so please support to be in with a chance of winning a car, €10,000 euro in cash and many more prizes.
Newtown Maggies G4MO’s team would like to congratulate Leanne Mullen a very Happy Milestone Birthday. Leanne is an integral part of our team and more fun than two twenty year olds, we all would like to wish her a very happy birthday.
Newtown Juniors FC
The fixtures (weather permitting) for the week ending Sat.17th/Sun.18th February are as follows:Under 8 Black – Fixture to be confirmed; Under 8 Red at home to Newcastle F.C. ko Sunday at 11.30am; Under 10 Black at home to Wicklow Town B ko Sunday at 10.15am; Under 10 Red – Fixture to be confirmed; Under 11’s away to Roundwood F.C. ko Sunday at 10am; U12 Black away to Rathnew F.C. ko to be confirmed; Under 12 Red at home to Coolboy Rangers ko Saturday at 11.15am; Under 13 Black away to Aughrim Rangers ko Sunday at 11.30am (Prov); Under 13 Red at home to St. Anthonys B ko Sunday at 10.15am; Under 14’s home to Shillelagh Utd ko Saturday at 11.30am (all fixtures & ko times are subject to change)
Our Club presentation day will take place on Saturday 24th February from 2pm until 4pm in the Newtown Community Centre. From our Development Squad to our Under 15’s all the annual awards will be presented on the day.
Our Club A.G.M. will also take place in the Community Centre on Monday 26th February starting at 7.30pm. All members are requested to attend. Regards our AGM if any member wishes to submit a motion they can do so on or before Saturday 24th February in writing to the Secretary at hughienolan@gmail.com . Also, any member who wishes to nominate people to the executive committee etc can also do so. This can be done on the floor of the AGM or before to the above address.
Our latest Last Man Standing competition started back recently with 184 players at the starting post and to say it was full of drama would be an understatement. This was down to Newcastle Utd’s failure to beat Luton Town at St James Park. The game finishing 4-4 meant that no less than 87 players who had selected the “Toon” have exited the competition in Week 1. A further 27 players also exited after their selections i.e. Chelsea, Bournemouth, Spurs, Burnley, Fulham & Liverpool all failed to register a win. Week 1 has seen a mammoth 114 players exit the competition in the opening week. Week 2 will be the fixtures for weekend 17th-19th February 2024. Fixtures for Week 2 will be sent to all remaining players on Monday 12th February. All competition rules are available on request. Many thanks for your continued support.
Our Golden Goals competition will start back on Saturday 17th February with the clash at the Etihad between Manchester City & Chelsea. We plan to run the competition every two weeks up to the Champions League final. Coupons are €2 each and can be purchased from any of our coaches or committee members.
RATHDRUM
Avondale GAA
Lotto - Results for Tuesday 6th February. Numbers drawn were 1-3-17-23. Two match three winners: Angel Kavanagh c/o Jacobs Well; Paul Larking c/o Brenda Kinsella. Thanks for all your continued support. Next draw will take place on Tuesday 13th February at 9pm. Jackpot is €5,000. The Avondale GAA club lotto can be done online by downloading the Clubforce app on to your phone or laptop on iPad and you can do the lotto on it up until 9pm on the night of the draw.
Juvenile Hurlers wanted - Are your children involved in a GAA club that does not field a hurling team but would like to give it a try? Avondale are fielding hurling teams from under 7s to under 15s and are looking to increase our playing numbers. This will not affect your child’s ability to continue playing football with their home club as hurling fixtures are on alternate weeks to football fixtures. Please contact Avondale GAA facebook page to find out more.
Nursery Programme - Our very successful nursery programme starts back up on Saturday 17th February at 9am. This year we are accepting kids born in 2019/2020. Please contact Eugene Dunne on 087 6569890 to sign up.
Help needed - Avondale GAA club needs your help if you can give your time to help in any area of the running of our club, be it admin or coaching. Do you want to be apart of your child’s journey? Contact Helen Penn on 086 8058983 for more information.
Condolences - Avondale GAA club sends its sincerest condolences to our much loved club member Brenda Kinsella on the passing of her uncle Liam O’Neill. The club also wishes to send its condolences to the family of Jimmy Murphy who sadly passed away. May both Liam and Jimmy rest in heavenly peace.
St Patrick’s Day Parade
Rathdrum saint patrick’s day parade committee held their first meeting last Wednesday and it was very well attended. The chairman of the parade committee Jimmy O’Shaughnessy would like to thank former secretary May Byrne and MC Denis Carter for all their help over the years that the parade has being going. The new secretary of the Rathdrum St Patrick’s day parade committee is Mr Steven Kearon.
The next meeting of the Rathdrum St Patrick’s day parade committee will take place on Wednesday 21st February at 7.30pm sharp in the Anne Devlin Annex behind Rowleys shop on the fairgreen, Rathdrum.
Women’s Circle
Womens Circle take place in Rathdrum on the first Friday of the month from 7.30pm to 9.30pm. Cost: €15 includes Tea/Coffee. Phone: 086 2428186 for more information.
Men’s Shed AGM
Rathdrum Men’s Shed are holding their annual general meeting on 29th February at 7.30pm in the parochial house. All members are welcome to attend. We are looking for new members so if you are interested in joining use Please come along.
Avondale Camogie Club recruitment
Avondale camogie club are looking for players for all age groups. Sign up to make friends for life all while enjoying the adventure of a new hobby.
U8s: 2017-2018 and U10s: 2015-2016 and U12s: 2012-2013 and U14s: 2010-2011 and U16s: 2008-2009 and Adults: age16+
Please direct message to Avondale camogie club facebook page for more information.
Rugby Club 50th anniversary gala dinner
Rathdrum Rugby Club is holding its 50th anniversary gala dinner on Saturday 2nd March at the Woodenbridge Hotel. Drinks reception from 7.30pm, meal from 8pm. Followed by drinks and dancing until late. Admission is €50. To purchase tickets contact Kira on 086 8839543.
Moneystown National School Fundraiser
Sign up for our school fundraiser the Moneystown National School 4 mile run on 2nd March at https://www.njuke.net/moneystown-4 mile/Moneystown-runireland/select-competition
A fun day out for all walk with the family or run. Cash prizes for the 1st three males and females home. Register on runireland enter on the day, 11am start road race
Wicklow Hospice Marathon/10k - update
Due to the high demand of entris in the Wicklow Hospice Marathon and 10k will be no longer be taking entries for the 2024 run in Avondale.
Clara LGFA news
Exciting times ahead for Clara ladies with a new junior team starting Dust off your football boots or why not try football for the first time Old and new players welcome. The first training will be Friday 16th February. For further details will follow in the coming days Please PM if you are interested in playing.
Go Raibh Maith agat - Thanks to everyone who attended our fundraising event last night and everyone who purchased raffle tickets over the last two days Thanks to our musicians the medics the bandits and Clara,s Dj Colin Mc Coy
Our event would not have ran without the support of the Clara LGFA volunteers. A heartfelt thanks to Noel and Helen and staff of Jacobs Well. Thanks to centra Rathdrum for allowing Clara LGFA sell raffle tickets on Friday and Saturday. Our raffle would not have been possible without the support of our sponsors. Please support our local sponsors.
The funds raised will assist with the running cost of our club and equipment.
Rathdrum Historical Society
Dates for your diary for upcoming talks.
Monday 4th March: John Hinde Postcards, speaker is Jim Scannell.
Monday 8th April: Fr Browne’s photos of Co Wicklow, speaker Dr Robert O’Byrne.
Monday 13th May: The assassination of Percival Lee Wilson and the Caravaggio, speaker Des Kiely.
All talks start at 8pm in the Anne Devlin Annex of the R.D.A hall, Rathdrum A67 YC93. Everyone welcome. Entry is €5.
Rathdrum Parish News
Ash Wednesday - The season of Lent begins on Ash Wednesday 14th February. Ashes will be distributed after 9am mass in Rathdrum Parish Church
Lent in Greenane church - The stations of the cross will be held in Greenane church on Ash Wednesday and every Monday evening for the duration of lent at 7.30pm
Trocaire Boxes - These are available at each of our churches of the parish
Prayers and Sympathy - The parish and community extends its prayers and sympathy to the families of Tommy McNabb, Rudie Dorrepaal, Liam O’Neill and Jimmy Murphy. May they rest in peace.
Pilgrimage To Medjugorje - Maura and Michael Heffernan from Greenane are organising a pilgrimage to Medjugorje from 10th to 17th October. The price of the Pilgrimage is €785. If you would like more information contact Maura or Michael or contact Marian Pilgrimages on 01 8788159 or www.marian.ie
Your News
Any group or organisation who wants to put notes in to the Rathdrum notes in the Wicklow People newspaper should forward the information via email to Sandyshaugh44@gmail.com or text/Whatsapp the message to 083 3575421 before 3pm on Sunday evening.
